title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: " He was David McGhie, of Back Mill Lands, at Kirkmessan,"  answered the boy.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: " No, not the Knifer — my own real father, David McGhie  of Back Mill Lands! " said the Kid.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: It was in these complicated family circumstances that the Kid, legal and real head of the Clan McGhie, and son of David, late of Back Mill Lands, became Pat's assistant and confidant in her first struggles for independence in the Hammer-ridden house of Boreham-Egham.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: It appears that my man is some far-out relative of David McGhie, that boy's father, and that there were certain papers in the old house at Back Mill Lands which would help me.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: He would never be taken for Kid McGhie of the Back Mill Lands.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Small responsibilities, such as the Kid, sat very lightly on Mad Mag, late of Back Mill Lands, Kirkmessan.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: But Marthe, more skilled in the ill-doing families of Kirkmessan, and the scandal of Back Mill Lands, shook her head.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: HE rear portions of Back Mill Lands looked toward the red freestone walls, the many windows, and glittering conservatories of 'Balmaghie.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Bitter Airchie (he was always so called) could have told you, and indeed did tell everyone who cared to listen and some who, being obliged to Archie, had to listen whether they liked it or not, how David of Back Mill Lands was the true and only original McGhie of McGhie and Kirkmessan,  whose direct male ancestor had retour of the lands in 1585 when the Lords of the Congregation were distributing  that which did not belong to them.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: But here he erred grievously,  as Davie of the Back Mill Lands would have had no difficulty in showing, if he had cared a happ'orth about the matter.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: The Kid had never been before — and it was a long time ere he was again — so popular in Back Mill Lands, the heritage of his fathers.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Heads began to appear from the scandalized houses surrounding  Back Mill Lands — heads unkempt and middle- aged, heads old and white-mutched, heads young and curl- papered.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: But Back Mill Lands it was.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Back Mill Lands was no place for a single man, nor, when he was married, for his wife.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: This policeman, Patrick Adair, a pitiful man where women were concerned, saw Mag safe to the entrance of Back Mill Lands.

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: She spat on the gateposts of the manses, threw dirt at the provost's windows, and was only persuaded away by a night policeman, who told her that she was wanted at " home " — that is, in the gabled, whitewashed barrack in Back Mill Lands which still, in

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: " Kid," said his father — that is to say, David McGhie, Esquire, of Back Mill Lands in the town of Kirkmessan — "ye see this?

title: Fishers of men,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: The Kid was nine years of age and already known to all Kirkmessan — from the turnip-girthed provost in his white waistcoat to the waifs and strays of the Back Mill Lands where the Kid dwelt — when his father, to get away from the
